FuncDef:
The nat64 user-session create-rate command sets the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a NAT64 device.
The undo nat64 user-session create-rate command restores the default rate.
By default, the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E is 64 kpps, the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S is 1 kpps.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a NAT64 device.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 64, in kilo packets per second.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the rate at which packets are sent to create a flow on a NAT64 device, run the nat64 user-session create-rate command. If the rate at which packets are sent exceeds the configured rate, excess packets are discarded.
Prerequisites
A NAT64 instance has been created, and the NAT64 session number limit function has been enabled. By default, the limit function is enabled.
